title: Memory of Meijer de Haan

thumbnail.alt_text: A work made of wood-block print printed twice in black and brown ink, with dry brush and gray and ocher watercolor, on cream japanese paper.

medium_display: Wood-block print printed twice in black and brown ink, with dry brush and gray and ocher watercolor, on cream Japanese paper
credit_line: Gift of the Print and Drawing Club
publication_history:
Marcel Guérin, L'Oeuvre Gravé de Gauguin (Paris, 1927), n.p., cat. 53 (ill.).

The Art Institute of Chicago, Gauguin Prints (Chicago, 1959), n.p. (ill.).

Elizabeth Mongan, Eberhard W. Kornfeld, and Harold Joachim, Paul Gauguin: Catalogue Raisonné of His Prints (Bern, 1988), p. 160, no. 38.

Wadsworth Atheneum Museum of Art, Gauguin's Nirvana: Painters at Pouldu 1889-90, exh. cat. (Hartford, Conn., 2001), pp. 122, 125, fig. 169.

June Hargrove, "Gauguin's Maverick Sage: Meijer de Haan" in Visions: Gauguin and His Time (Amsterdam, 2010), pp. 100-101, fig. 10.
exhibition_history:
Paris, Galerie de la Pléiade, "Gauguin: Oeuvre Gravé," May 26–June 14, 1931, cat. 29.

The Art Institute of Chicago, "Gauguin: Paintings, Drawings, Prints, Sculpture," February 12-March 29, 1959, p. 87, cat. 173; traveled to the Metropolitan Museum of Art, New York, April 21-May 31, 1959.

Tate Modern, London, "Gauguin: Maker of Myth," September 30, 2010–January 16, 2011, pp. 75, 84, fig. 12; traveled to National Gallery of Art, Washington D.C., February 27–June 5, 2011, cat. by Belinda Thompson, ed.

The Art Institute of Chicago, "Gauguin: Artist as Alchemist",  June 25 - September 10, 2017, pp. 45n20, 178, 187, cat. 116, cat. by Gloria Groom, et. al., traveled to Paris, Réunion des musées nationaux - Grand Palais, October 9, 2017 - January 21, 2018.
provenance_text: Georges Daniel de Monfreid (1856-1929, Paris) by the winter of 1896-97 [Guérin 1927] from the artist.  Louis Huc (son-in-law of Monfreid) by 1931 [Paris 1931]. Sold by Gerald Cramer, Geneva, to the Art Institute, 1952.
section_titles: Cat. 86  Memory of Meijer de Haan, 1896/97
